title: Select Tokens
content:
A token is a system value that's automatically resolved internally when the property is read. Token values are available only for the following:

  • String property for a component type, component template, service component in a design, or resource offering
  • Parameter when a topology component operation has a mapping type of Context Property Token
  • String parameter input for an action
  • A parameter value to a script that's configured on configuration options property that's configured for Input Validation
  • A parameter value to a script that's configured on configuration options property of type List that's Dynamic Entry
  • A parameter value to a script that's configured on a user operation input parameter that's configured for Input Validation
  • A parameter value to a script that's configured on a user operation input parameter that has a mapping type of Prompt User List with the list configured for Dynamic Entry

The Design and Deploy (DND) capability doesn't support some tokens. The following tables show the available tokens, their descriptions, applicable areas, and whether they are supported in DND. 

Server-side tokens

Token Description Supported in DND? Applies to
Action Name

[TOKEN:ACTION_NAME]

 Resolves to the value of ORDER when initially ordering a subscription and to the value of MODIFY_SUBSCRIPTION when modifying an existing subscription. No
Parent Service Component ID

[TOKEN:PRN_COMPONENT_ID]

Resolves to the Service Component ID of the parent service component.

For resource offerings, the Service Component ID refers to the service component that the resource offering is associated with in a service design.

 Yes
  • Component Template
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
  • Service Component
Resource Binding ID

[TOKEN:RSC_BINDING_ID]

 Resolves to the Resource Binding ID that was created at subscription time. Yes
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
Resource Subscription ID

[TOKEN:RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]

 Resolves to the Resource Subscription ID that was created from the resource offering at subscription time. Yes
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
Selected Provider ID

[TOKEN:RSC_PROVIDER_ID]

 Resolves to the Provider ID that was selected at subscription time. Yes
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
Selected Resource Pool ID

[TOKEN:RSC_POOL_ID]

 Resolves to the Resource Pool ID that was selected at subscription time. Yes
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
Service Blueprint ID

[TOKEN:SVC_BLUEPRINT_ID]

 Resolves to the Service Blueprint ID. Yes
  • Component Template
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
  • Service Component
Service Catalog ID

[TOKEN:SVC_CATALOG_ID]

 Resolves to the Service Catalog ID used at subscription time. No
Service Component ID

[TOKEN:SVC_COMPONENT_ID]

Resolves to the Service Component ID of the component associated with this action.

For resource offerings, the Service Component ID refers to the service component that the resource offering is associated with in a service design.

 Yes
  • Component Template
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
  • Service Component
Service Component Type

[TOKEN:SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE]

Resolves to the Service Component Type (for example, Server) of the component associated with this action.

For resource offerings, the Service Component Type refers to the service component that the resource offering is associated with in a service design.

 Yes
  • Component Template
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
  • Service Component
Service Instance ID

[TOKEN:SVC_INSTANCE_ID]

 Resolves to the Service Instance ID created at subscription time. Yes
  • Component Template
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
  • Service Component
Service Offering ID

[TOKEN:SVC_OFFERING_ID]

 Resolves to the Service Offering ID. No
Service Request Organization ID

[TOKEN:REQ_ORG_ID]

 Resolves to the Organization ID associated with the service request. Yes
  • Component Template
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
  • Service Component
  • Configuration Options
Service Request User ID

[TOKEN:REQ_USER_ID]

 Resolves the User ID associated with the service request. Yes
  • Component Template
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
  • Service Component
  • Configuration Options
Subscriber's Email Address

[TOKEN:SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL]

 Resolves to email address of the subscriber. Yes
  • Component Template
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
  • Service Component
Subscriber's Organization ID

[TOKEN:USR_ORG_ID]

 Resolves to the Organization ID associated with the subscriber. No
Subscription ID

[TOKEN:SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]

 Resolves to the Subscription ID created at subscription time. Yes
  • Component Template
  • Provider Selection
  • Resource Offering
  • Service Component

Client-side tokens

Token Description Supported in DND? Applies to
[CLIENT:<property_name>] Allows you to have a dependency on a value of another property in the same option. This allows, for example, a parameter to a script on a Site option property (of type List, configured for Dynamic Entry) to reference the value of a Region option property on the same option. Note that <property_name> refers to the property Name, and not its Display Name. Yes Configuration Options
[CLIENT:<parameter_name>] Allows you to have a dependency on a value of a user operation input parameter. This allows, for example, an input validation script to retrieve the value of an action parameter input for validation. Yes User Operations
[PROVIDER:<provider_name>:ID]

The ID of the provider with the specified name that was selected by the subscriber when ordering the subscription.

 Yes

Resource Offerings

Portal tokens

When a subscription is owned by a group, a requesting user can be different than the user who made the initial subscription request. Use portal tokens to retrieve the context of the requesting user.

Token Description Supported in DND? Applies to
Catalog ID

[PORTAL:CATALOG_ID]

 The ID of the catalog where a consumer user submits an initial subscription request or a request to modify an existing subscription. No
Organization ID

[PORTAL:ORG_ID]

 The ID of the Organization to which the consumer user who submits a subscription request belongs. No
Organization Name

[PORTAL:ORG_NAME]

 The name of the Organization to which the consumer user who submits a subscription request belongs. No
User Email

[PORTAL:USER_EMAIL]

 The email address of the consumer user who submits an initial subscription request or a request to modify an existing subscription. No
User ID

[PORTAL:USER_ID]

 The ID of the consumer user who submits an initial subscription request or a request to modify an existing subscription. No
User Name

[PORTAL:USER_NAME]

 Resolves to the User Name. No
